title: Iasmin Goes
text:
I am an Assistant Professor of Political Science at Colorado State University. I study the political economy of natural resources, with a focus on how international organizations promote natural resource governance in the Global South. Other topics of interest include sovereign debt, statistical capacity, energy transitions, and economic development broadly defined.
Between 2020 and 2022, I was a Junior Research Fellow at the Carlos III - Juan March Institute in Madrid. Before that, I received a PhD in Government and an MS in Statistics from the University of Texas at Austin, in addition to degrees in Political Science and Latin American Studies from Freie Universität Berlin. I was born in Brazil and named Iasmin (rather than the more traditional variant Yasmin) because Y was not a letter of the Portuguese alphabet at the time. In my free time, I like to swim, bike, run, cook, and read fiction; you can check out what I am currently reading here.

title: Teaching
text:

Undergraduate: Global Environmental Politics, International Relations, International Organization


Universidad Carlos III de Madrid (2020-2022)
Graduate: International Relations
Undergraduate: International Politics

title: Research
text:
Publications

Iasmin Goes (2023). “New Data, New Results? How Data Sources and Vintages Affect the Replicability of Research.” Research & Politics 10(2):1–13. PDF (Open Access) | Replication Materials
Iasmin Goes (2023). “Examining the Effect of IMF Conditionality on Natural Resource Policy.” Economics & Politics 35(1):227–285. PDF (Open Access) | Replication Materials
Iasmin Goes (2022). “Electoral Politics, Fiscal Policy, and the Resource Curse.” Studies in Comparative International Development 57:525–576. PDF (Gated) | PDF (Ungated, View Only) | Replication Materials
Iasmin Goes (2013). “Between Truth and Amnesia: State Terrorism, Human Rights Violations and Transitional Justice in Brazil.” European Review of Latin America and the Caribbean 94:83–96. PDF (Open Access)


Working Papers
Iasmin Goes and Stephen B. Kaplan. “Crude Credit: The Political Economy of Natural Resource Booms and Sovereign Debt Management.” Revised & Resubmitted. PDF
Iasmin Goes. “Measurement Uncertainty in International Statistics.” Under Review. PDF
Ariana Ribeiro Costa, Iasmin Goes, and Carolina Moehlecke. “The Determinants of FDI Inflows: Evidence from Firm and Municipality-Level Data in Brazil.”
Iasmin Goes and Daniel Weitzel. “You Should (Probably) Not Split Your Sample.”
